title: Install Windows 7 & Windows XP from same dvd

forumNotes.author: florin91
forumNotes.content:
Hi!  

I am in the following situation: I have an Windows 7 install dvd and an windows xp install cd and I want to "copy" the windows xp files to hdd, among windows 7 install files and burn them to a 4.7 dvd, so I could install / boot both the Windows 7 install and windows xp install from the same dvd.  

The problem is not the dvd space, as it fits both on the 4.7 GB -\> \~3 GB + 700 MB =\~ 3.7GB \< 4.7 GB  

The problem is the booting method and the boot loader used.  

I was thinking at a solution like this: copy both medium files to hdd, add menu.lst on root and insert into it  

title Windows7Install ...  
title WindowsXPInstall .... and then burn the dvd with grldr as boot loader.  

Or, somehow, try to "use" windows xp install bootloader to boot windows7install files or use windows7install boot loader to boot windowsxpinstall files, something with boot.ini or bcd files.  

I think I described well my situation and I'm waiting for ideas / solutions / links.  

Cheers!

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
I would suggest you just add the XP i386 files to a folder on the Win 7 install DVD.  
When you boot from the Win7 install DVD you can then use WinPE to install XP onto the hard disk.  
Tutorial #3 on the RMPrepUSB website describes this (for a USB drive) but it will work from a DVD. You could create a WinPE shell script to automate it.  

Alternatively, you could create a wim file of a completed XP install and just apply the image to a hard disk using ImageX...

forumNotes.author: cdob
forumNotes.content:
> boot both the Windows 7 install and windows xp install from the same dvd  
>
> The problem is the booting method and the boot loader used.
Windows 7 DVD uses a boot loader already. You may include XP install.  

[http://www.msfn.org/...post__p__951608](http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/146594-multiboot-dvdusb-xp7vista-is-it-possible/page__view__findpost__p__951608 "External link")  

Copy XP files to hard disk first, Windows 7 install next. Overwrite a XP \\setup.exe.  
That way Windows 7 \\setup.exe goes to DVD.
